NAEB PLACEMENT SERVICE
Anyone wishing to register with the Placement Service should contact Mr. R. E,
Underwood, Jr., 14 Gregory Hall, Urbana, Illinois, and the proper registration
forms will be forwarded immediately. Also, any employers interested in the can¬
didates listed below should contact Mr. Underwood for particulars.
The following candidates have registered recently with us. We urge you to retain
past issues of the Supplement for information concerning other candidates.
December 1. A mature woman, with two grown sons, would like to assist in teach¬
ing young people radio ver?-c. Wide radio experience, including continuity, traffic
and woman’s director over a total of 14 years. Very strong in continuity, with
4 years as radio continuity director; presently continuity writer, traffic director
and film supervisor of commercial TV station. B.A., will take courses to obtain
master’s degree, if necessary. Prefers midwest town where she can become part
of the community. *
December 2. A producer-director of educational films dissatisfied with present
duties as manager of 16mm distribution office desires employment with an educa¬
tional TV station offering better use of his capabilities. Wide experience, all
phases of film work. Also, eight years as commercial artist. Good knowledge of
music and languages. Fulbright Scholarship to Italy, 1950-51.
December 3. A young single man of 30 has had 4 years experience in educational
radio, 2 years in commercial radio, and 2j> years in international radio. B.A. in
Speech-Radio; M.A. this year in Speech-Radio-Television. Has had one year of
college level teaching experience. Is interested in radio and/or television pro¬
duction and direction. $4000 minimum.
December 4* A creative designer desires a position as Art Director in an educa¬
tional television station. His ten years of professional experience includes:
writing, design and direction of motion picture films (animated and live-action)
for television theaters: management of own advertising art business; advertising
and sales promobion layout and design for national accounts. Presently working
in conjunction with an educational television station, but would prefer full-time
employment in the field. Single, male, age 30.
December 5. A mature gentleman is seeking a position as a producer-coordinator
or area chairman in radio and television. Ph.D. in Speech. 15 years commercial
radio experience; 6 years experience in college and university teaching; 3 years
as director of ETV workshop. Extensive experience in radio and television curricu¬
lum development. Producer of many ETV programs. Looking for a challenge.
December 6. A radio executive with an exceptional background is interested in
entering the educational broadcasting field. Seventeen years work in commercial,
propaganda and educational broadcasting here and abroad. M.A. plus complete know¬
ledge of programming and production. Expect good salary.
December 7. A young married man with years commercial experience as producer-
director is interested in management or a position leading to management. B.S.
in speech, Northwestern University. Also experienced in promotion, sales, and
advertising. Television positions have given him heavy experience in musical,
dramatic, and religious shows, plus all types of remotes.
